intro: Teramnus stolzii, commonly known as the Stolz's teramnus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, often followed by small, red berries. Teramnus stolzii is typically found in woodland and shrubland habitats, thriving in partial shade.
